name: Versive
headline: AI-first user research platform
description:
Versive is an all-in-one research platform that helps teams make faster customer-informed decisions.
- Collect richer insights: AI-moderated studies that deliver interview-quality results at the survey speeds
- Accelerate your analysis: AI-assisted analysis that instantly turns transcripts into shareable insights
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:saas; industry:b2b; industry:design-tools; industry:market-research; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: David Correa Orozco, Founder
founders.description: David is the CEO of Versive. He started his career as a PM at Microsoft working on the Windows Build System. He then became one of the founding engineers at Bread (NYSE: BFH) where he developed multiple fin-tech products. Most recently, he spent the last 3 years working on Serverless Networking systems at Google Cloud. He is now focusing on building an AI-survey platform that enables teams to gather better user insights, faster.

founders.name: Eric Li, Founder
founders.description: Eric is the co-founder of Versive. Previously, he led product and design at Vareto, designed marketplace products at Uber Eats, and was the first designer at Bread (NYSE: BFH). In a past life, he studied Economics at UChicago and was an investment banker at J.P. Morgan.

generated_description:
### Versive Overview

Meet **Versive**, an innovative AI-first research platform that's shaking up how teams approach customer insights. Founded in **2022** and a proud member of **Y Combinator's Batch W23**, this compelling startup operates out of **San Francisco**. With a lean team of just **three**, Versive is on a mission to empower organizations to make faster, customer-informed decisions without the usual research hassles.

### Mission

Versive exists to streamline user research, transforming the way teams gather and analyze data. They understand the common challenge: teams often forgo essential research due to time constraints. So, they’ve built a solution that flips that narrative on its head.

### Key Features

1. **AI-Moderated Studies**: Think faster, high-quality insights at the speed of surveys. Versive leverages AI to conduct studies that feel like interviews. It’s not just about collecting data; it’s about digging deeper to understand the *why* behind customer behaviors.

2. **Accelerated Analysis**: Say goodbye to endless hours of sifting through notes. Their AI-assisted analysis converts transcripts into shareable insights in minutes, making it easy to summarize findings and report back to the team.

3. **Flexible Feedback Tools**: Versive offers a variety of modes for gathering data:
   - Beautifully designed surveys
   - AI-driven interviews that follow up with probing questions
   - Usability tests that capture user reactions in real-time
   - Multilingual capabilities to reach wider audiences effortlessly

4. **Seamless Sharing**: Users can generate insightful reports that combine quantitative and qualitative data, with a mere click of a button. Plus, with deep analysis tools, teams can reveal recurring themes, backed by real quotes from their studies.

5. **Smart Recruitment**: Need participants? Versive simplifies recruitment through panel partnerships, allowing users to focus on insights rather than logistics.

### Why It Matters

Versive is not just about speed; it's about **quality insights**. Teams are praising the platform for providing deeper and more actionable data compared to other tools they’ve used in the past. The goal is clear: to free teams from the traditional research bottlenecks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters—understanding their users.

### The Road Ahead

As Versive continues to refine its offerings, it’s positioned to become an integral part of how businesses approach market research—namely, faster, deeper, and more intuitive. If you’re intrigued and want to see how this AI-powered platform can change your research game, you can explore more at their [website](https://www.getversive.com).

So, if your team is tired of the “no time for research” excuse, it might be time to take a closer look at what Versive has to offer. You're not just collecting insights—you're transforming how decisions are made.
